definitions.title: Pi.
definitions.body: sq. [[פְּנֵי]], [[פָּנֶיךָ]], [[פָּנַיִךְ]] = mollify, appease, entreat the favour of, lit. make the face of any one sweet or pleasant (cf. Ar. h.ala0, h.aliya, be sweet, pleasant, Aram. h.liy, [[חֲלִי]], id., adj. [[חָלֵי]] sweet);—

definitions.title: a.
definitions.body: mollify, pacify, appease ´[[י]], i.e. induce him to shew favour in place of wrath and chastisement Ex 32:11 (JE), 1Ki 13:6 ( + [[הִתְפַּלֵּל]]), v:1Ki 13:6, 2Ki 13:4, Je 26:19 (+ [[וַיִּנׇּ֫חֶם]]), 2Ch 33:12 (‖[[וַיִּכָּנַע מאד מִלִּפְנֵי]]), Da 9:13; also [[פני־אֵל]] ´[[ח]] Mal 1:9 (sq. [[וִיחָנֵּ֫נוּ]] that he may be gracious to us).

definitions.title: b.
definitions.body: entreat the favour of ´[[י]], i.e. aim at success, prosperity, etc., through his favour, 1Sa 13:12 (in anticipation of war), Zec 8:21, Zec 8:22 (‖´[[לְבַקֵּשׁ אֶת־י]]; of cities and nations assembling at Jerusalem for worship), Zec 7:2 (‖´[[לְבַקֵּשׁ אֶת־י]]) of worship at Jerusalem; quite gen., as habit of God-fearing man, Ps 119:58 (+ [[בְּכָל־לַב]]).

definitions.body: )—´[[רַבִּים יְח]] [[פני־נׇדִיב]] Pr 19:6 many entreat a prince's favour (‖[[וְכָל־הָרֵעַ לְאִישׁ מַתָּן]]); [[פָּנׇיִךְ]] ´[[יח]] Ps 45:13 of favour of king's bride; [[פָּנַיִךְ רַבִּים]] ´[[וְח]] Job 11:19 favour of Job when absolved and restored.
